## Websites

* Getting Started with R and RStudio, [view the website](https://ourcodingclub.github.io/tutorials/intro-to-r/).

* How to Use Git/GitHub with R, [view the website](https://rfortherestofus.com/2021/02/how-to-use-git-github-with-r/).

* Tidy Tuesday data repository, [view the repository](https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/tree/master).

* The R Graph Gallery, [view the website](https://r-graph-gallery.com/index.html).

* From Data to Viz website on visualizing data, [view the website](https://www.data-to-viz.com/#explore).

* [Julia Silge's](https://juliasilge.com/) blog posts (mostly) on TidyTuesday data analyses, [view the website](https://juliasilge.com/blog/).

* Analyzing US Census Data: Methods, Maps, and Models in R textbook, [view the free online version of the text](https://walker-data.com/census-r/).

* Tidy Finance with R, [view the free online version of the text](https://www.tidy-finance.org/).

* Outstanding User Interfaces with Shiny textbook, [view the free online version of the text](https://unleash-shiny.rinterface.com/).

* Crime by the Numbers: A Criminologistâ€™s Guide to R textbook, [view the free online version of the text](https://crimebythenumbers.com/).
